intro: Iris chamaeiris proles italica, commonly known as the Italian marsh iris, is a flowering plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Native to southern Europe, particularly Italy, this species thrives in wet or marshy environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, three-petaled flowers. It is often found in shallow water or along the edges of ponds and wetlands.
